Generation I.Red: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
Generation I.Yellow: Small and weak, this Pok é mon is adept with its bone club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.
Generation I.Stadium: Originally a small and weak Pokémon, it became rough and aggressive when it begin  using bones as weapons.

Generation II.Gold: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.
Generation II.Silver: It collects bones from an unknown place. A Marowak graveyard exists somewhere in the world, rumors say.
Generation II.Crystal: Somewhere in the world is a cemetery just for Marowak . It gets its bones from those graves.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It collects bones from an unknown place. A Marowak graveyard exists somewhere in the world, rumors say. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pok é mon 's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
Generation III.Sapphire: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pok é mon 's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
Generation III.Emerald: A Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has grown tough by overcoming the grief of losing its mother. Its tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
Generation III.FireRed: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

Generation IV.Diamond: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation IV.Pearl: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation IV.Platinum: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It collects bones from an unknown place. Some whisper that a Marowak graveyard exists somewhere in the world.

Generation V.Black: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation V.White: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation V.Black 2: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Generation V.White 2: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

Generation VI.X: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
Generation VI.Y: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokémon's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This Pokémon's tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.

Generation VII.Sun: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.
Generation VII.Moon: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The rich greenery of the Alola region is hard on Marowak. It controls fire to stay alive.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: When it beats opponents with its bone, the cursed flames spread to them. No amount of water will stop those flames from burning.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It has transformed the spirit of its dear departed mother into flames, and tonight it will once again dance in mourning of others of its kind.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It has transformed the spirit of its dear departed mother into flames, and tonight it will once again dance in mourning of others of its kind.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and dances through the night as a way to mourn its fallen allies.
Generation VIII.Shield: The cursed flames that light up the bone carried by this Pokémon are said to cause both mental and physical pain that will never fade.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The bones it uses have been in its possession since it was born. It has a ferocious nature.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The bones it uses have been in its possession since it was born. It has a ferocious nature.
